author: Francesco Ronchi
title: Italy’s Crisis—and Europe’s
text:
Minor decisions and small mistakes can change history. Italian President Sergio Mattarella’s decision to reject the populist right-left coalition’s attempt to form a government in Italy may turn out to be a turning point for Europe.
While Mr. Mattarella’s desire to protect the country from turbulence is no doubt sincere, his action could end up having the opposite result. By openly invoking the role of investors, financial markets and the defense of the eurozone in his speech on Sunday, the president lends credence to the...
